0.reference: Well, here's a story for you

1.reference: Sarah Perry was a veterinary nurse who had been working daily at an old zoo in a deserted district of the territory

2.reference: so she was very happy to start a new job at a superb private practice in north square near the Duke Street Tower

3.reference: That area was much nearer for her and more to her liking

4.reference: Even so, on her first morning, she felt stressed

5.reference: She ate a bowl of porridge, checked herself in the mirror and washed her face in a hurry

6.reference: Then she put on a plain yellow dress and a fleece jacket, picked up her kit and headed for work

7.reference: When she got there, there was a woman with a goose waiting for her

8.reference: The woman gave Sarah an official letter from the vet

9.reference: The letter implied that the animal could be suffering from a rare form of foot and mouth disease, which was surprising, because normally you would only expect to see it in a dog or a goat

10.reference: Sarah was sentimental, so this made her feel sorry for the beautiful bird

11.reference: Before long, that itchy goose began to strut around the office like a lunatic, which made an unsanitary mess

12.reference: The goose's owner, Mary Harrison, kept calling, "Comma, Comma," which Sarah thought was an odd choice for a name

13.reference: Comma was strong and huge, so it would take some force to trap her, but Sarah had a different idea

14.reference: First she tried gently stroking the goose's lower back with her palm, then singing a tune to her

17.reference: In no time, the goose began to tire, so Sarah was able to hold onto Comma and give her a relaxing bath

18.reference: Once Sarah had managed to bathe the goose, she wiped her off with a cloth and laid her on her right side

19.reference: Then Sarah confirmed the vet's diagnosis

20.reference: Almost immediately, she remembered an effective treatment that required her to measure out a lot of medicine

21.reference: Sarah warned that this course of treatment might be expensiveâ€”either five or six times the cost of penicillin

22.reference: I can't imagine paying so much
